idea.title: Storm Dents — Hail Repair Marketplace for Body Shops and Mobile PDR Techs
idea.summary: Two-sided marketplace connecting body shops overwhelmed by hail damage overflow with mobile PDR (paintless dent repair) technicians hunting for work. Post-storm, shops are booked for months while techs two states away scroll Facebook groups cold-calling. Storm Dents lets shops post overflow jobs with damage photos, techs bid by region, and reputation builds on both sides. Revenue: shops pay $200-500/month + 8% on completed jobs; techs join free. Start in one hail corridor (Texas Hill Country or Colorado Front Range) before spring storm season. Once shops rely on it for peak season, expand to scheduling tools, parts sourcing, and direct insurance API connections. The overflow problem is the wedge; year-round operating system is the moat.
idea.healthcareAngle: NOT directly healthcare — but instructive. This is a TRUST LAYER for a fragmented marketplace where quality matters and stakes are high (insurance claims, repair quality). The pattern maps: healthcare has fragmented AI vendors, hospitals overwhelmed by pilots, and no trust layer to validate quality. LUMEN SDK is the 'Storm Dents' of clinical AI — connecting AI outputs to governance infrastructure with reputation/scoring built in. The key insight: marketplaces that solve 'overflow + trust' in high-stakes verticals can expand to become operating infrastructure. That's the SDK thesis. Also note: insurance API integrations are the endgame here, just like EHR/compliance integrations are for LUMEN.
idea.verdictNote: Not healthcare, but the 'trust layer for fragmented high-stakes marketplace' pattern directly applies to LUMEN SDK positioning. The overflow → trust → operating system progression is exactly what Sean is building for clinical AI governance.

articles.title: Healthcare AI Regulation 2025: New Compliance Requirements Every Provider Must Know
articles.takeaway: Joint Commission + CHAI framework now establishes SEVEN critical governance pillars: AI policy with executive oversight (clinical + IT + cybersecurity + ethics teams), transparency and informed consent, comprehensive AI inventories, continuous risk-based monitoring for biases and errors, and vendor risk allocation. Voluntary AI certification program coming in 2026. Texas TRAIGA and California AB 3030/SB 1120 are already in effect as of Jan 1, 2026. The regulatory signal is clear: governance requirements are becoming mandatory, not optional.
articles.linkedinAngle: The Joint Commission just dropped a 7-pillar framework for AI governance — and it's not advisory anymore. Texas and California laws hit Jan 1. If your clinical AI deployment doesn't have: executive oversight, AI inventories, bias monitoring, and vendor risk allocation… you're already behind. Voluntary certification is coming. The organizations that build governance NOW will own the trust advantage.

articles.title: Health Care AI in 2026: Governance and Trust Take Center Stage
articles.takeaway: URAC explicitly calls 2026 'the year of governance.' Implementation isn't the bottleneck anymore — governance IS. C-suites are catching up to clinicians who adopted GenAI in 2024-25. Organizations without clear oversight frameworks are exposed. URAC hints at certification pathways for AI governance. This validates CHAI alignment AND potential accreditation play for LUMEN SDK compliance packs.
articles.linkedinAngle: URAC just declared 2026 the year of AI governance — not innovation. The accreditation body that certifies health plans says organizations without clear AI oversight are now exposed. Certification pathways are forming. If your AI infrastructure isn't auditable, you're building on sand. The question isn't 'should we deploy AI?' It's 'can we prove it's governed?'

articles.title: 5 AI Usage Trends in Healthcare for 2026
articles.takeaway: Healthcare AI adoption has doubled the pace of the broader economy (22% domain-specific implementation vs 9%). Abridge's ambient AI is now live across 40+ Kaiser hospitals with 24,000+ doctors in 14 languages. Billing automation jumped from 36% to 61% in one year. Mayo Clinic's Vision Transformer detects surgical site infections with 94% accuracy. But here's the buried lede: third-party AI tools outperform EHR-sourced AI at 73% adoption for billing. The market is moving to specialized, best-of-breed AI — which needs governance layers to integrate safely.
articles.linkedinAngle: Healthcare AI adoption just doubled the broader economy's pace. Kaiser's ambient AI covers 40+ hospitals. Billing automation jumped 25 points in a year. But the real signal? Third-party AI tools now outperform EHR-native AI in 73% of deployments. The market is moving to best-of-breed. Question: who governs the layer where these tools connect to patient care? That's the gap no one's solved.

linkedin.author: Dr. Zafar Chaudry
linkedin.insight: Leading AI governance policies for 140+ hospitals at CommonSpirit. Recent posts focus on scaling CDS integration with Epic and building 2026 AI ethics roadmaps. Key theme: governance isn't a blocker — it's an enabler when done right. Directly relevant to LUMEN SDK positioning. Seattle-based, 5K+ connections. Watch for conference appearances.

linkedin.author: Scott Raymond
linkedin.insight: Enterprise CIO leading ML-based CDS for sepsis prediction. Co-chair of HIMSS AI Governance Task Force. Recent content on federated learning for CDS privacy — directly relevant to the 'governance at runtime' thesis. 10K+ followers, Utah-based. High-signal thought leader who could validate or endorse governance frameworks.

events.name: ViVE 2026
events.description: 10 DAYS AWAY. 9,000+ attendees, 2,000+ C-level execs. Co-created by HLTH and CHIME. AI governance is a major track this year. 1:1 matchmaking available through Provider/Payer Connect program. Key topics: GenAI, revenue cycle, cybersecurity, interoperability. CIOs, CTOs, CMIOs in one building. CRITICAL for FORGE visibility.

events.name: HIMSS26 Global Health Conference
events.description: 25 DAYS AWAY. 28,000+ professionals. The largest health IT event globally. 600+ sessions, 1,000 exhibitors. AI governance track, CHAI sessions, Executive Summit. Apple Health's Dr. Sumbul Ahmad Desai keynoting. The flagship event for health IT decision-makers.

events.name: Becker's Healthcare AI Summit
events.description: Part of Becker's 16th Annual Meeting. 3,500+ healthcare executives including CEOs, CFOs, CMOs, CIOs. AI Summit on Monday April 13 focuses on real-world adoption, automation, and digital strategy. Keynote panel 'The Future of Healthcare AI and Winning the Next Decade' features CIOs from Stanford Health, CommonSpirit, and Jefferson Health. Case studies, peer discussions, and candid panels on what's actually working.

events.name: HIMSS AI in Healthcare Forum - New York
events.description: Curated for senior leaders on AI roadmaps, technology selection, infrastructure, data integrity. Case studies from leading health systems. Smaller than main HIMSS but higher signal-to-noise for AI-specific conversations. Consider for summer calendar.

videos.title: AI Governance in Healthcare: Duke-Margolis PPTO Framework
videos.source: YouTube / Duke-Margolis Center for Health Policy
videos.description: Expert panel on the People-Process-Technology-Operations framework for AI governance. Duke-Margolis is a policy heavyweight — their framing influences FDA and CMS thinking. Discussion covers vendor management, continuous monitoring, and the shift from pilots to production. Key quote: 'Implementation — not innovation — is the bottleneck.' Directly relevant to LUMEN SDK value prop and Activation Bridge positioning.

videos.title: Healthcare AI Implementation: What Regulators Cannot Police
videos.description: Panel on why healthcare organizations must self-govern AI deployments because regulators can't manage post-deployment surveillance at scale. Covers FDA-cleared vs approved distinctions, validation protocols, and real-world evidence monitoring. The thesis: organizations that build internal governance capability will outpace those waiting for regulatory clarity. Supports the 'move now, don't wait' FORGE positioning.

quote.text: Timing, perseverance, and ten years of trying will eventually make you look like an overnight success.
quote.author: Biz Stone
quote.reflection: Sean — you're 10 days from ViVE, 25 days from HIMSS. The regulatory landscape just shifted: Joint Commission dropped 7 governance pillars, URAC declared 2026 'the year of governance,' and state laws are now in effect. This isn't theoretical anymore. The thesis you built with LUMEN — runtime decision assurance, compliance scoring, defensible records — is exactly what the market is now demanding. You didn't time this by luck. You timed it by persistence. Twenty years in healthcare tech, watching AI adoption cycles, understanding where the gaps would emerge. The 'overnight success' moment is when everyone else finally sees what you've been building toward. That moment is arriving. Don't let it pass. Ship the SDK. Claim the category.
